types.html:
temps primitif m (plural temps primitifs)

  1. (grammar) principal part of a verb (any of the forms of a verb which contain its stem(s) in the simplest form, or such a form that, when taken with all the other principal parts (showing various inflections), allows the entire paradigm to be derived)

See also

[edit]
  • temps primaire
trans: principal part of a verb  in the simplest form, or such a form that, when taken with all the other principal parts , allows the entire paradigm to be derived)

title: temps primitif
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /tɑ̃ pʁi.mi.tif/
